definition: animals used for their physical strength (mules, oxen etc)/beast of burden
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Generally, oil cakes are used to feed livestock.
sentences.chinese: 一般枯饼都是用来喂牲口的。

sentences.english: Shamire lives in the barn in Wyoming.
sentences.chinese: 夏米尔还活着，在怀俄明州的牲口棚里。

sentences.english: It also aims to safeguard public health through testing and control of live food animals.
sentences.chinese: 该署并检验和管制食用牲口，保障市民的健康。

sentences.english: He was then placed in a barn and filled with hay.
sentences.chinese: 然后被放置在牲口棚里，装满了干草。
“等等”，康拉的说，“咱们把牲口棚加高一些吧。”

sentences.english: The farmer herded the cows over to the barn door.
sentences.chinese: 农夫把奶牛赶到牲口棚门口。

sentences.english: In Sweden, there is a train that works mainly on cattle.
sentences.chinese: 在瑞典，就有一种主要靠牲口开动的火车。

sentences.english: The barn smelled so bad that she held her nose.
sentences.chinese: 牲口棚恶臭难闻，她捏住了鼻子。

sentences.english: The herdsman rings his cattle every morning.
sentences.chinese: 这个牧人每天上午在牲口群的周围绕着走。

sentences.english: Buyers cleared the day's cattle run at steady rates.
sentences.chinese: 买主以稳定的价格买光了这一天牵到集市来的牲口。

sentences.english: Shall not their cattle and their substance and every beast of theirs be ours?
sentences.chinese: 他们的群畜，货财，和一切的牲口岂不都归我们吗。

sentences.english: They try to round up a scattered herd of cattle.
sentences.chinese: 他们试图把分散的牲口赶在一起。

sentences.english: My father buckled the harness down and went away.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲把挽具扣在牲口身上就走了。

sentences.english: "He is, as you see, a very valuable animal, " said Maximilian.
sentences.chinese: “你看，它是一匹非常名贵的牲口，”马西米兰说。

sentences.english: There is a stack of hay a leaky barrel in the discard barn.
sentences.chinese: 在废弃的牲口棚中有一堆干草和一个漏的水桶。

definition: (of a livestock animal) plump and strong/well-fed
oxen and horses/beasts of burden/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
